application_ir.name: E-commerce API
application_ir.description: A backend API for a basic e-commerce system that allows managing a product catalog, registering customers, creating shopping carts, placing orders, and viewing purchase history.

entities.name: Product

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the product

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Product name (e.g., 'iPhone 15 Pro')

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Product description (e.g., 'Latest generation phone')

attributes.name: price
attributes.description: Product price (e.g., 999.99)

attributes.name: stock
attributes.description: Available stock quantity (e.g., 50 units)

attributes.name: is_active
attributes.description: Whether the product is active and available for purchase

entities.description: An item in the catalog that customers can purchase

entities.name: Customer

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the customer

attributes.name: email
attributes.description: Customer email address (e.g., ariel@example.com)

attributes.name: full_name
attributes.description: Customer full name (e.g., 'Ariel Martínez')

attributes.name: registration_date
attributes.description: Date when the customer registered (automatic, read-only)

entities.description: A person who registers to make purchases

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the cart

attributes.name: customer_id
attributes.description: Reference to the customer who owns this cart

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Cart status: OPEN (active, can modify) or CHECKED_OUT (converted to order, cannot modify)

entities.name: CartItem

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the cart item

attributes.name: cart_id
attributes.description: Reference to the cart this item belongs to

attributes.name: product_id
attributes.description: Reference to the product being purchased

attributes.name: quantity
attributes.description: Quantity of the product (e.g., 2)

attributes.name: unit_price
attributes.description: Snapshot of the product price at the time it was added to the cart

entities.description: An entry in the cart: a specific product with a quantity

entities.name: Order

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the order

attributes.name: customer_id
attributes.description: Reference to the customer who placed the order

attributes.name: order_status
attributes.description: Order status: PENDING_PAYMENT (created, awaiting payment), PAID (payment confirmed), CANCELLED (customer cancelled)

attributes.name: payment_status
attributes.description: Payment status: PENDING (waiting), SIMULATED_OK (simulated payment success), FAILED (simulated failure)

attributes.name: total_amount
attributes.description: Total order amount (sum of all items × quantity)

attributes.name: created_at
attributes.description: Date when the order was created (automatic, read-only)

entities.description: A confirmed purchase created from a cart during checkout

entities.name: OrderItem

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the order item

attributes.name: order_id
attributes.description: Reference to the order this item belongs to

attributes.name: product_id
attributes.description: Reference to the product that was purchased

attributes.name: quantity
attributes.description: Quantity purchased

attributes.name: unit_price
attributes.description: Snapshot of the product price at the time of purchase

entities.description: A line in the order: a specific product with quantity and price at purchase time

endpoints.description: Returns the health status of the API
Creates a new product with name, description, price, stock, and active status
Returns a paginated list of all active products (is_active = true)

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip for pagination (default: 0)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return (default: 20)

endpoints.description: Returns all information for a specific product by ID. Returns 404 if not found.
Updates name, description, price, stock, or active status of an existing product
Marks a product as inactive (is_active = false). Does not delete it, just hides it.
Creates a new customer account with email and full name. Returns 400 if email already exists.
Returns complete information for a customer by ID. Returns 404 if not found.
Creates an OPEN cart for a customer. If an OPEN cart already exists, it is reused instead of creating a new one.
Returns the OPEN cart for a customer with all items and subtotals

Adds a specific product with quantity to the cart. Validates: product is active, sufficient stock, if product already in cart then increase quantity instead of duplicating, captures current price as unit_price. Returns 400 if product is inactive or insufficient stock.
Changes the quantity of a product in the cart. If quantity <= 0, removes the item. If quantity > available stock, returns 400.
Removes all items from the OPEN cart

Customer completes purchase. System: 1) validates cart is not empty, 2) validates sufficient stock for ALL items, 3) deducts stock from products, 4) creates order with status PENDING_PAYMENT, 5) marks cart as CHECKED_OUT, 6) calculates total amount automatically. Returns 422 if insufficient stock.

Marks an order as paid. Current status must be PENDING_PAYMENT. Changes to PAID + payment_status to SIMULATED_OK. Only allowed if order is awaiting payment. Returns 400 if order is not in PENDING_PAYMENT status.
Cancels an order and returns stock. Current status must be PENDING_PAYMENT. Changes to CANCELLED. Adds back the quantity to products. Returns 400 if order is not in PENDING_PAYMENT status.
Returns all information for an order by ID. Returns 404 if not found.
Returns all orders for a customer, optionally filtered by status

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by order status (PENDING_PAYMENT, PAID, CANCELLED)

endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of all carts (inferred best practice)
endpoints.inference_reason: CRUD best practice: list endpoint for carts

endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of all customers (inferred best practice)
endpoints.inference_reason: CRUD best practice: list endpoint for customers

endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of all orders (inferred best practice)
endpoints.inference_reason: CRUD best practice: list endpoint for orders

endpoints.description: Delete a specific cart by ID (inferred best practice)
endpoints.inference_reason: CRUD best practice: delete endpoint for cart

endpoints.description: Delete a specific product by ID (inferred best practice)
endpoints.inference_reason: CRUD best practice: delete endpoint for product

endpoints.description: Delete a specific customer by ID (inferred best practice)
endpoints.inference_reason: CRUD best practice: delete endpoint for customer

endpoints.description: Delete a specific order by ID (inferred best practice)
endpoints.inference_reason: CRUD best practice: delete endpoint for order

endpoints.description: Basic health check (inferred infrastructure best practice)
Readiness check with dependencies (inferred infrastructure best practice)
Prometheus-compatible metrics endpoint (inferred infrastructure best practice)

flows.name: F1: Create Product
flows.trigger: API request to create a new product

steps.description: Validate product data (name required, price > 0, stock >= 0)
Return created product with generated ID

flows.description: The system allows creating a new product with name, description, price, stock, and active status

flows.name: F2: List Active Products
flows.description: Users can obtain a paginated list of all available products (is_active = true)

flows.name: F3: View Product Details
flows.trigger: API request to get a specific product
flows.description: Obtain all information for a specific product by ID. Returns 404 if not found.

flows.name: F4: Update Product
flows.trigger: API request to update a product

steps.description: Validate updated data (price > 0, stock >= 0 if provided)

flows.description: Change name, description, price, stock, or active status of an existing product

flows.name: F5: Deactivate Product
flows.trigger: API request to deactivate a product
flows.description: Mark a product as inactive (is_active = false). Does not delete it, just hides it.

flows.name: F6: Register Customer
flows.trigger: API request to register a new customer

steps.description: Create customer record with registration date

flows.description: Create new customer account with email and full name. Returns 400 if email already exists.

flows.name: F7: View Customer Details
flows.trigger: API request to get customer information
flows.description: Obtain complete information for a customer by ID. Returns 404 if not found.

flows.name: F8: Create Cart
flows.trigger: API request to create a cart for a customer

steps.description: Check if customer already has an OPEN cart
If OPEN cart exists, return existing cart; otherwise create new cart with status OPEN
steps.condition: only if no OPEN cart exists

flows.description: The system creates an OPEN cart for a customer. If an OPEN cart already exists, it is reused instead of creating a new one.

flows.name: F9: Add Item to Cart
flows.trigger: API request to add a product to the cart

steps.description: Validate cart ID exists and is OPEN
Check if product already in cart
If product exists in cart, increase quantity; otherwise create new cart item with current product price as unit_price

flows.description: Add a specific product with quantity to the cart. Validates: product is active, sufficient stock, if product already in cart then increase quantity instead of duplicating, captures current price as unit_price.

flows.name: F10: View Current Cart
flows.trigger: API request to view cart contents

steps.description: Retrieve all cart items with product details
Calculate subtotals for each item (unit_price × quantity)
Return cart with items and totals

flows.description: Obtain the OPEN cart for a customer with all items and subtotals

flows.name: F11: Update Item Quantity
flows.trigger: API request to change item quantity in cart

steps.description: Validate cart ID exists and is OPEN

flows.description: Change the quantity of a product in the cart. If quantity <= 0, removes the item. If quantity > available stock, returns 400.

flows.name: F12: Clear Cart
flows.trigger: API request to empty the cart

steps.description: Validate cart ID exists and is OPEN

flows.description: Remove all items from the OPEN cart

flows.name: F13: Checkout (Create Order)

steps.description: Validate cart ID exists and is OPEN

steps.condition: cart has at least one item

steps.description: Validate sufficient stock for ALL cart items
Create order with status PENDING_PAYMENT and payment_status PENDING
Copy cart items to order items
Calculate total amount as SUM(unit_price × quantity)

flows.description: Customer finalizes purchase. System: 1) validates cart is not empty, 2) validates sufficient stock for ALL items, 3) deducts stock from products, 4) creates order with status PENDING_PAYMENT, 5) marks cart as CHECKED_OUT, 6) calculates total amount automatically.

flows.name: F14: Pay Order (Simulated)
flows.trigger: API request to mark order as paid

steps.description: Update order_status to PAID and payment_status to SIMULATED_OK

flows.description: Mark an order as paid. Current status must be PENDING_PAYMENT. Changes to PAID + payment_status to SIMULATED_OK. Only allowed if order is awaiting payment.

flows.name: F15: Cancel Order
flows.trigger: API request to cancel an order

steps.description: Return stock to products (add back quantities from order items)

flows.description: Cancel an order and return stock. Current status must be PENDING_PAYMENT. Changes to CANCELLED. Adds back the quantity to products.

flows.name: F16: List Customer Orders
flows.trigger: API request to view customer's order history
flows.description: View all orders for a customer, optionally filtered by status

flows.name: F17: View Order Details
flows.trigger: API request to get order information
flows.description: Obtain all information for an order by ID. Returns 404 if not found.

invariants.description: F9: Add Item to Cart uses Cart
F9: Add Item to Cart uses Product

rules.condition: name is required and cannot be null

rules.error_message: Product name must be between 1 and 255 characters
Product description must not exceed 2000 characters

rules.condition: price is required and cannot be null

rules.error_message: Product price must be greater than 0

rules.condition: stock is required and cannot be null
email is required and cannot be null

rules.error_message: Customer email must be a valid email address

rules.condition: email must be unique across all customers
full_name is required and cannot be null

rules.error_message: Customer full name must be between 1 and 255 characters

rules.condition: customer_id must reference an existing customer
status must be OPEN or CHECKED_OUT
each customer can only have one OPEN cart at a time
rules.error_message: Customer already has an open cart

rules.condition: cart_id must reference an existing cart
product_id must reference an existing product
quantity is required and cannot be null
unit_price is required and cannot be null

rules.error_message: Unit price must be greater than 0

rules.condition: product must be active (is_active = true) to be added to cart
rules.error_message: Cannot add inactive product to cart

rules.condition: quantity must not exceed available product stock
if product already exists in cart, increase quantity instead of creating duplicate item
customer_id must reference an existing customer
order_status must be PENDING_PAYMENT, PAID, or CANCELLED
payment_status must be PENDING, SIMULATED_OK, or FAILED
total_amount is required and cannot be null
total_amount is calculated automatically as SUM(unit_price × quantity) for all items
order can only be paid if current status is PENDING_PAYMENT
rules.error_message: Order cannot be paid in current status

rules.condition: order can only be cancelled if current status is PENDING_PAYMENT
rules.error_message: Order cannot be cancelled in current status

rules.condition: order_id must reference an existing order
product_id must reference an existing product
quantity is required and cannot be null
unit_price is required and cannot be null

rules.error_message: Unit price must be greater than 0
